intro: Stephanomeria minor, commonly known as the narrowleaf stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Stephanomeria minor is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it has adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
